messages.content: You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the main objective of the T-VER-S-METH-06-12 methodology?
The main objective of the T-VER-S-METH-06-12 methodology is to utilize waste cooling energy from the LNG process to replace traditional chiller systems, thereby improving energy efficiency.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What types of projects are covered under this methodology?
The methodology covers projects aimed at enhancing energy efficiency in buildings, factories, and households.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the conditions that must be met for a project to qualify under this methodology?

The conditions include: 1) Equipment from other projects cannot be considered; 2) Waste cooling energy from the LNG process must be retrievable; 3) The project must utilize waste cooling energy to replace existing or new chillers.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
When did the T-VER-S-METH-06-12 methodology come into effect?
The T-VER-S-METH-06-12 methodology came into effect on March 1, 2023.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the baseline scenario for this project methodology?
The baseline scenario involves using the cooling energy from the project to replace electricity consumption that would have been sourced from traditional chillers powered by fossil fuels.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What kind of greenhouse gas emission activities are considered in the calculations?
The calculations consider emissions related to electricity consumption, specifically CO2 emissions generated from using electricity for cooling.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is meant by 'Waste Cooling Energy Recovery' in the context of this methodology?

Waste Cooling Energy Recovery refers to the process of capturing and reusing the waste cooling energy generated during the LNG phase change from liquid to gas, to produce cooling energy instead of relying on traditional chillers.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
Is there any restriction on the equipment used in projects under this methodology?
Yes, any equipment that has been used in other projects cannot be included in the scope of this methodology.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the implications of not adhering to the project's conditions?
If the conditions are not adhered to, the project may not qualify for the voluntary emission reduction credits outlined in this methodology.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does the project outline entail regarding the use of waste cooling energy?
The project outline entails using waste cooling energy to effectively replace the operation of existing chillers, ensuring that energy efficiency is not negatively impacted by the project.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the main purpose of the project described in the context?

The main purpose of the project is to utilize waste cooling energy from the process of converting LNG from liquid to gas to produce replacement cooling energy for chillers, thereby avoiding negative impacts on energy efficiency.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the two scenarios considered for calculating greenhouse gas emissions?

The two scenarios considered are the baseline scenario where electricity is used from the original chillers powered by fossil fuels, and the operational scenario where waste cooling energy is recovered and utilized for cooling.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the baseline greenhouse gas emission calculated?
The baseline greenhouse gas emission is calculated based on the carbon dioxide emissions from electricity used for the original chiller system, using performance data and operational hours.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the formula to calculate greenhouse gas emissions from the baseline scenario?

The formula is BEy = BEEc.y, where BEy represents the amount of greenhouse gas emissions from the baseline scenario in year y (tCO2/year) and BEEc.y represents the emissions from the electricity used by the conventional chiller system in year y (tCO2/year).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does the term 'Waste Cooling Energy Recover' refer to in this context?

Waste Cooling Energy Recover refers to the system that captures and reuses waste cooling energy from the LNG conversion process to produce cooling energy, thereby replacing the need for traditional chillers.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the significance of the specific energy consumption (SEC) in the project?

The specific energy consumption (SEC) indicates the energy efficiency of the baseline chiller system, which is necessary for calculating the potential emissions reduction when using the waste cooling energy recovery system.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the cooling load produced by the waste cooling energy recovery system calculated?

The cooling load (QPJ.j.y) is calculated using the formula: QPJ.y = (1 / 3.517) x mpJ.j.y x Cp x (TPJ,in.j.y - TPJ,out.j.y), where mpJ.j.y is the mass flow rate of the cooling water, Cp is the heat capacity of water, and TPJ,in.j.y and TPJ,out.j.y are the inlet and outlet temperatures respectively.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What role does the Thailand Greenhouse Gas Management Organization (TGO) play in this project?

The Thailand Greenhouse Gas Management Organization (TGO) oversees the management of greenhouse gas emissions and supports initiatives like this project aimed at reducing emissions through innovative technologies.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the potential environmental impacts of the project?
The project is designed to ensure that the reuse of waste cooling energy does not negatively impact the energy efficiency of the process, thus minimizing any adverse environmental effects.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the relationship between fossil fuel consumption and the baseline scenario?

The baseline scenario assumes that the original chillers operate using electricity generated from burning fossil fuels, thus contributing to greenhouse gas emissions which the new project aims to reduce.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the cooling load produced from the waste heat recovery system calculated for group j in year y?

The cooling load (Qpu,jy) is calculated using the formula: QPliy = 1 3.517 X mpJ,jy X Cp X (TpJ,in,jy - TPJ,out,j,y) where MpJ.j.y is the mass flow rate of chilled water, Cp is the specific heat capacity of water (4.187 kJ/kg-°C), TPJ,in.j.y is the average inlet temperature of chilled water, and TPJ,out.j.y is the average outlet temperature of chilled water.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does TR stand for in the context of cooling load calculations?
TR stands for 'Ton of Refrigeration'. It is a unit of measure for cooling capacity, where 1 TR is equivalent to 3.517 kJ/s.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the components used to calculate the specific energy consumption of the baseline chiller system?

The specific energy consumption (SECBLj) is calculated using the formula: SECBL,j = (ChPBL,j X QBLj) + PCHP,BL,j + PCDP,BL,j divided by QBL,j, where ChPBL,j is the performance of the baseline chiller, QBL,j is the cooling load from the baseline chiller, and PCHP,BL.j and PCDP,BL.j are the power of the chilled water and cooling water pumps, respectively.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What happens if the cooling load from the waste heat recovery system exceeds the baseline case?

In this case, the greenhouse gas emissions from the use of electricity in the baseline chiller system (BEEGY) is calculated using the formula: BEEC.y = [(SECBL) X QBLj X hpJ.j.y X 10-3) + (SEC BL, SD.j X (QpJ.j.y - QBLi) x hpJ.j.y X 103)] x EFEC,PJ,y.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the cooling load from the baseline chiller calculated using average water temperatures?

The cooling load from the baseline chiller (QBLj) can be calculated using the formula: QBLj = 3.517 X MBL,j X Cp X (TBL,in,j - TBL,out,j), where MBL,j is the mass flow rate of chilled water, Cp is the specific heat capacity of water (4.187 kJ/kg-°C), TBL,in.j is the average inlet temperature, and TBL,out.j is the average outlet temperature.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the two options for calculating the cooling load from the baseline chiller?
The two options for calculating the cooling load from the baseline chiller (QBL.j) are: 1) using average water temperatures, or 2) using data from the chiller's specification document.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the significance of the coefficient EFEC,PJ,y in the emissions calculation?

EFEC,PJ,y represents the greenhouse gas emission factor for electric power consumption in year y, measured in tCO2/MWh, and is used to calculate the total greenhouse gas emissions associated with electricity use in the chiller system.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the formula for calculating the specific energy consumption according to the defined regulations?

The specific energy consumption according to regulations (SEC BL,SD.j) is calculated using the formula: SECBL,SD,j = ((ChPBL,SD,j X QBLj) + PCHP,BL,j + PCDP,BL,j) divided by QBL,j, where ChP BL,SD.j is the performance of the chiller as defined in the regulations.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the performance of the chiller quantified in the baseline scenario?
The performance of the chiller in the baseline scenario is quantified using the ChPBL,j value, which represents the chiller's efficiency in kilowatts per ton of refrigeration (KW/TR).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the role of the parameter hpJ.j.y in the emissions calculation?

The parameter hpJ.j.y represents the operating hours of the waste heat recovery system in group j for year y and is crucial for determining the total emissions based on the cooling load produced during those hours.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is TBL,out,j in the context of the cooling water system?
TBL,out,j represents the average temperature of the outgoing cold water in the mechanical chiller system for group j, measured in degrees Celsius (°C).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the electrical power of the chiller calculated in the baseline case?

The electrical power of the chiller in the baseline case for group j (PBL,j) is calculated using the formula: PBL,j = ChPBL,Spec,j * QBL,j * CFChP,BL,j, where ChPBL,Spec,j is the performance value as specified in the machine's documentation.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does SECBL,SD,j represent?
SECBL,SD,j represents the specific energy consumption of the mechanical chiller system in the baseline case for group j, as defined in the ministerial regulations (KW/TR).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the formula for calculating greenhouse gas emissions from the use of electricity in the cooling system?

The formula for calculating greenhouse gas emissions from the use of electricity in the cooling system is: BEEc,y = (SECBL,SD,j * QpJ.j.y * hpJ.j.y) * 10 * EFEC,PJ,y, where QpJ.j.y is the cooling load produced from waste cooling energy recovery.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does PEy indicate in the context of greenhouse gas emissions?

PEy indicates the total greenhouse gas emissions from the project in year y, measured in tons of CO2 per year (tCO2/year). It is calculated based on the emissions from electricity usage during the project.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the specific energy consumption of the waste cooling energy recovery system calculated?

The specific energy consumption of the waste cooling energy recovery system in group j for year y (SECPJ.j.y) is calculated using the formula: SECPJ.j.y = (PCHP,PL.i.y + PCDP,PL.i.y) / QPJ.j.y, where PCHP and PCDP are the electrical powers of the respective pumps.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the components that contribute to greenhouse gas emissions in the cooling system?

The components that contribute to greenhouse gas emissions in the cooling system include the electrical power consumed by the cooling pumps (PCHP,BL,j and PCDP,BL,j) and the performance parameters defined in the specifications and regulations.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the significance of the term 'Waste Cooling Energy Recover'?

The term 'Waste Cooling Energy Recover' refers to the process of capturing and reusing waste cooling energy from the LNG phase change process to produce replacement cooling energy, thereby reducing the need for new chillers.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does the term 'EFEC,PJ,y' represent?
EFEC,PJ,y represents the greenhouse gas emission factor for electricity usage in year y, measured in tons of CO2 per megawatt-hour (tCO2/MWh).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the cooling load produced from waste cooling energy recovery (QpJ.j.y) defined?

The cooling load produced from waste cooling energy recovery (QpJ.j.y) is defined as the amount of cooling produced by the system utilizing waste cooling energy in group j during year y, measured in tons of refrigeration (TR).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the formula to calculate greenhouse gas emissions from electricity use in project group j for year y?
The formula is PEEc.y = (SECpujyXQpJjyx hpvj.y x 10°) x EFEC,P.J.Y, where PEEc.y represents the amount of greenhouse gas emissions from electricity use for project group j in year y (in tCO2/year).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the specific energy consumption of the system for recycling waste heat calculated?

It is calculated using the formula SECPJ.j.y = (PCHP,Pl.i.y + PCDP, Pl.i.y) / QPJ.j.y, where PCHP.PJj.y is the power of the cooling water pump and PCDP,PJ.J.y is the power of the cooling water pump for the cooling system.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What parameters need to be monitored according to the project monitoring plan?

The monitoring plan requires tracking parameters like PBL.j (power of the chillers in the baseline scenario), CF ChP,BL,j (correction factor for power per ton of cooling), MBL,j (mass flow rate of chilled water), and TBL,in.j and TBL,out.j (average inlet and outlet temperatures of chilled water).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the cooling load produced by the system calculated?

The cooling load QPJy is calculated using the formula QPJy = 3.517 x mpJ.j.y x Cp x (TpJ,in.j.y - TpJ,out.j.y), where mpJ.j.y is the mass flow rate of chilled water, Cp is the specific heat capacity of water, and TpJ,in.j.y and TpJ,out.j.y are the average temperatures of the inlet and outlet water, respectively.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does ERy represent in the context of greenhouse gas emissions reduction?

ERy represents the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions in year y, calculated as ERy = BEy - PEy - LEy, where BEy is the emissions from the baseline scenario, PEy is the emissions from the project, and LEy is the emissions outside the project boundary.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the significance of EFEC,PJy in the greenhouse gas emissions calculation?
EFEC,PJy is the greenhouse gas emissions factor for electricity use in year y, expressed in tCO2/MWh, and is essential for determining the total emissions from electricity consumption.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
Are there any emissions considered outside the project boundaries?
According to the context, there are no operations related to emissions outside the project boundaries (Leakage Emission).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the specific heat capacity value of water used in calculations?
The specific heat capacity of water (Cp) used in calculations is 4.187 kJ/kg-°C.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the average temperature of inlet water in the system determined?
The average temperature of inlet water (TpJ,in.j.y) is determined through engineering measurements or data recorded from installed measuring instruments in the system.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the two options for the source of data for the mass flow rate of chilled water in the baseline scenario?
The mass flow rate of chilled water in the baseline scenario (MBL,j) can be sourced from either engineering measurements or records from installed measuring instruments in the system.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does the parameter 'CF ChP,BL,j' represent?
The parameter 'CF ChP,BL,j' represents the electrical load correction value per ton of cooling for the chiller.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the mass flow rate of chilled water in the system defined?

The mass flow rate of chilled water in the chiller system, defined as 'MBL,j', is measured in kg/s and can be sourced from engineering measurement tools or recorded data from installed measurement instruments.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the significance of the parameter 'TBL,in.j'?
'TBL,in.j' signifies the average inlet temperature of chilled water in the chiller system, measured in degrees Celsius (°C), and can be obtained through engineering measurements.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the two options for obtaining 'ChPBL,j'?
'ChPBL,j' indicates the performance value of the chiller in the baseline case for group j and can be obtained either from the manufacturer's specifications or through engineering measurement results.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the unit of measurement for 'P CHP,BL.j'?
'P CHP,BL.j' is measured in kilowatts (kW) and represents the electrical power of the chilled water pump in the baseline case for group j.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does 'Cp' refer to in this context?
'Cp' refers to the specific heat capacity of water, which is equal to 4.187 kJ/kg-°C, according to thermodynamic properties.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the purpose of tracking the parameter 'EFEC,PJ.y'?
'EFEC,PJ.y' is tracked to determine the greenhouse gas emission factor for electricity usage in year y, measured in tCO2/MWh.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How should the emission factor be calculated when using electricity from other producers?
When using electricity from other producers, the emission factor should be calculated according to the latest version of T-VER-S-TOOL-02-01.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does the parameter 'ChP BL,SD,j' reflect?
'ChP BL,SD,j' reflects the specific energy consumption of the mechanical chiller system in the baseline case for group j, as specified in the ministerial regulation.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the relevance of the parameter 'mpJ.j.y'?
'mpJ.j.y' is defined as the mass flow rate, measured in kg/s, and is part of the parameters to be monitored in the system.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does the parameter EFEC,PJ.y represent?
EFEC,PJ.y represents the greenhouse gas emission factor for electricity usage in year y, measured in tCO2/MWh.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the emission factor (EFEC,PJ.y) determined when using electricity from the transmission system?
When using electricity from the transmission system, the emission factor is obtained from the greenhouse gas emission reports published by the Thailand Greenhouse Gas Management Organization (TGO).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What should be done if the year of carbon credit certification does not have an announced EFEC,PAY value?
If the year of carbon credit certification does not have an announced EFEC,PAY value, the latest EFEC,PJ,y value announced by TGO should be used instead for that year.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does the parameter mpJ.j.y measure?
mpJ.j.y measures the mass flow rate of the cooling energy recovery system for group j in year y, expressed in kg/s.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the two options for measuring the mass flow rate of the cooling energy recovery system?

The two options for measuring the mass flow rate are: 1) Random sampling using engineering measurement tools, covering normal and peak load conditions at least once a year; 2) Using data from a recording system installed within the system, covering the monitoring period.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
For parameter TpJin.j.y, what does it signify?
TpJin.j.y indicates the inlet temperature of the cooling energy recovery system for group j in year y, measured in degrees Celsius (°C).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How should the outlet temperature of the cooling energy recovery system (TpJ,out.j.y) be measured?

TpJ,out.j.y should be measured using either random sampling with engineering measurement tools covering normal and peak load conditions at least once a year, or by using data from an installed measurement system that covers the monitoring period.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does the parameter hpJ.j.y represent?
hpJ.j.y represents the number of operational hours of the cooling energy recovery system for group j in year y, measured in hours/year.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the methods to assess the operational hours of the cooling energy recovery system?

Operational hours can be assessed by using a hour meter for continuous measurement throughout the monitoring period, reporting monthly detailed data, or by estimating based on the operational hours specified by TGO.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What information does the parameter P CHP, PJ.j.y provide?
P CHP, PJ.j.y provides the power capacity of the chilled water pump in the cooling energy recovery system for group j in year y, measured in kilowatts (kW).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the purpose of using data from the measurement system for the cooling energy recovery project?
The purpose is to track and report the hours of operation of the cooling energy recovery system, ensuring that the data covers the relevant monitoring period.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What parameter does 'hpJ.j.y' represent?
'hpJ.j.y' represents the number of operating hours of the cooling energy recovery system from project group j in year y.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the operational time of the cooling energy recovery system measured?
It is measured using a time meter (Hour Meter), with continuous monitoring throughout the reporting period, and detailed reports provided monthly.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the two sources of data for measuring the electrical power of the cooling pump?
The two sources of data are: 1) values specified by the manufacturer, and 2) measurement results from engineering tools or recorded data from installed measuring instruments.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does 'P CHP, PJ.j.y' signify?
'P CHP, PJ.j.y' signifies the electrical power of the water pump in the cooling energy recovery system for project group j in year y.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What type of data is used to evaluate the operating hours as required by TGO?
The evaluation is based on the results from the measurement of the operating hours of the cooling energy recovery system and assessments according to TGO guidelines.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What changes were made in the document on March 1, 2566?
Changes included the document's code change, project type modifications, an addition of project start date descriptions, and updates to parameter symbols and meanings.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does 'P CDP, PJ.j.y' refer to?
'P CDP, PJ.j.y' refers to the electrical power of the cooling water pump in the cooling energy recovery system for project group j in year y.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the significance of the reference document CDM Methodology AM0060?
The reference document provides methodologies for power saving through the replacement by energy-efficient chillers, which is relevant for evaluating the cooling energy recovery project's impact.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How is the electrical consumption per ton of cooling evaluated based on temperature?
It is evaluated using tables that show the electrical consumption per ton of cooling based on varying inlet and outlet temperatures of the cooling water or air.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the purpose of the Thailand Greenhouse Gas Management Organization (TGO)?
The Thailand Greenhouse Gas Management Organization (TGO) is established to manage greenhouse gas emissions in Thailand, promoting voluntary emission reduction programs such as T-VER.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What does T-VER stand for?
T-VER stands for Thailand Voluntary Emission Reduction Program, which is a program aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions voluntarily.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the energy efficiency performance standards for air-cooled chillers according to the 2009 regulations?
According to the regulations, air-cooled chillers of all types and sizes must have an energy efficiency performance standard of 0.95 kW per ton of cooling.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
How does the electricity consumption per ton of cooling change with the inlet water temperature of the chiller?

The electricity consumption per ton of cooling decreases as the inlet water temperature of the chiller increases, as shown in the provided table where lower temperatures correspond to higher electricity usage.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the electricity consumption per ton of cooling for chillers at an inlet air temperature of 10 degrees Celsius?
At an inlet air temperature of 10 degrees Celsius, the electricity consumption per ton of cooling is 0.80 kW for air-cooled chillers.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the significance of the year 2552 in the context of the chiller efficiency regulations?

The year 2552 in the Thai Buddhist calendar corresponds to 2009 in the Gregorian calendar, which is when the regulations regarding high-efficiency chillers for air conditioning systems were established.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What types of chillers are mentioned in the document, and what is their energy efficiency requirement?

The document mentions various types of chillers including air-cooled, water-cooled, piston type, rotary, screw, and centrifugal chillers. The energy efficiency requirement varies, with air-cooled chillers needing 0.95 kW/ton, while water-cooled screw or scroll types require 0.60 kW/ton.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the impact of increasing the outlet water temperature on the efficiency of chillers?

Increasing the outlet water temperature typically leads to a decrease in the energy efficiency of the chillers, as evidenced by the data showing higher temperatures correlate with higher electricity consumption.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the role of the Department of Alternative Energy Development and Efficiency in relation to the provided data?
The Department of Alternative Energy Development and Efficiency is the source of the data presented, which outlines the efficiency standards and performance metrics for chillers.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the minimum energy efficiency requirement for centrifugal chillers with a capacity of over 300 tons?
The minimum energy efficiency requirement for centrifugal chillers with a capacity of over 300 tons is 0.50 kW per ton of cooling.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the objective of the Thailand Voluntary Emission Reduction Program, particularly regarding transportation?
The objective of the Thailand Voluntary Emission Reduction Program is to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by using blended biofuels as a substitute for diesel or gasoline in land transportation.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What types of projects are covered under this methodology for reducing greenhouse gas emissions?
The types of projects covered include renewable energy projects or those that substitute fossil fuels with biofuels.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What are the specific types of vehicles that can participate in this program?
The vehicles that can participate include personal cars, buses, commercial trucks, and trains.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the baseline scenario for calculating greenhouse gas emissions in this program?
The baseline scenario is the greenhouse gas emissions from the combustion of gasoline or diesel that is replaced by biofuels in land transportation.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What types of biofuels can be used according to this methodology?
The methodology permits the use of biodiesel blended with regular diesel (specifically B7) and gasoline blended with ethanol (specifically E10).
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
When did the methodology come into effect?
The methodology came into effect on March 1, 2023.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What information must be specified regarding the biofuel used in the projects?
The project must specify the type and quantity of the biofuels used.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the minimum blending percentage for biodiesel to qualify as B7 according to the program?
The minimum blending percentage for biodiesel to qualify as B7 is 7% by volume.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What is the significance of the project starting date in the context of this program?
The project starting date is significant as it marks the actual date when biofuels are used and greenhouse gas reduction activities are recorded.
You are an expert in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) topics.
What organization oversees the Thailand Voluntary Emission Reduction Program?
The program is overseen by the Thailand Greenhouse Gas Management Organization (Public Organization), known as TGO.
